49 template <typename SizeType>
50 inline void fuse_dimensions(SizeType* MADNESS_RESTRICT const fused_size,
51  SizeType* MADNESS_RESTRICT const fused_weight,
52  const SizeType* MADNESS_RESTRICT const size,
53  const Permutation& perm) {
54  const unsigned int ndim1 = perm.dim() - 1u;
55 
56  int i = ndim1;
57  fused_size[3] = size[i--];
58  while ((i >= 0) && (perm[i + 1u] == (perm[i] + 1u)))
59  fused_size[3] *= size[i--];
60  fused_weight[3] = 1u;
61 
62  if ((i >= 0) && (perm[i] != ndim1)) {
63  fused_size[2] = size[i--];
64  while ((i >= 0) && (perm[i] != ndim1)) fused_size[2] *= size[i--];
65 
66  fused_weight[2] = fused_size[3];
67 
68  fused_size[1] = size[i--];
69  while ((i >= 0) && (perm[i + 1] == (perm[i] + 1u)))
70  fused_size[1] *= size[i--];
71 
72  fused_weight[1] = fused_size[2] * fused_weight[2];
73  } else {
74  fused_size[2] = 1ul;
75  fused_weight[2] = 0ul;
76 
77  fused_size[1] = size[i--];
78  while ((i >= 0) && (perm[i + 1] == (perm[i] + 1u)))
79  fused_size[1] *= size[i--];
80 
81  fused_weight[1] = fused_size[3];
82  }
83 
84  if (i >= 0) {
85  fused_size[0] = size[i--];
86  while (i >= 0) fused_size[0] *= size[i--];
87 
88  fused_weight[0] = fused_size[1] * fused_weight[1];
89  } else {
90  fused_size[0] = 1ul;
91  fused_weight[0] = 0ul;
92  }
93 }
94 
96 
113 template <typename InputOp, typename OutputOp, typename Result, typename Arg0,
114  typename... Args>
115 inline void permute(InputOp&& input_op, OutputOp&& output_op, Result& result,
116  const Permutation& perm, const Arg0& arg0,
117  const Args&... args) {
118  detail::PermIndex perm_index_op(arg0.range(), perm);
119 
120  // Cache constants
121  const unsigned int ndim = arg0.range().rank();
122  const unsigned int ndim1 = ndim - 1;
123  const typename Result::size_type volume = arg0.range().volume();
124 
125  // Get pointer to arg extent
126  const auto* MADNESS_RESTRICT const arg0_extent = arg0.range().extent_data();
127 
128  if (perm[ndim1] == ndim1) {
129  // This is the simple case where the last dimension is not permuted.
130  // Therefore, it can be shuffled in chunks.
131 
132  // Determine which dimensions can be permuted with the least significant
133  // dimension.
134  typename Result::size_type block_size = arg0_extent[ndim1];
135  for (int i = int(ndim1) - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
136  if (int(perm[i]) != i) break;
137  block_size *= arg0_extent[i];
138  }
139 
140  // Combine the input and output operations
141  auto op = [=](typename Result::pointer result,
142  typename Arg0::const_reference a0,
143  typename Args::const_reference... as) {
144  output_op(result, input_op(a0, as...));
145  };
146 
147  // Permute the data
148  for (typename Result::size_type index = 0ul; index < volume;
149  index += block_size) {
150  const typename Result::size_type perm_index = perm_index_op(index);
151 
152  // Copy the block
153  math::vector_ptr_op(op, block_size, result.data() + perm_index,
154  arg0.data() + index, (args.data() + index)...);
155  }
156 
157  } else {
158  // This is the more complicated case. Here we permute in terms of matrix
159  // transposes. The data layout of the input and output matrices are
160  // chosen such that they both contain stride one dimensions.
161 
162  // Here we partition the n dimensional index space, I, of the permute
163  // tensor with up to four parts
164  // {I_1, ..., I_i, I_i+1, ..., I_j, I_j+1, ..., I_k, I_k+1, ..., I_n}
165  // where the subrange {I_k+1, ..., I_n} is the (fused) inner dimension
166  // in the input tensor, and the subrange {I_i+1, ..., I_j} is the
167  // (fused) inner dimension in the output tensor that has been mapped to
168  // the input tensor. These ranges are used to form a set of matrices in
169  // the input tensor that are transposed and copied to the output tensor.
170  // The remaining (fused) index ranges {I_1, ..., I_i} and
171  // {I_j+1, ..., I_k} are used to form the outer loop around the matrix
172  // transpose operations. These outer ranges may or may not be zero size.
173  typename Result::size_type other_fused_size[4];
174  typename Result::size_type other_fused_weight[4];
175  fuse_dimensions(other_fused_size, other_fused_weight,
176  arg0.range().extent_data(), perm);
177 
178  // Compute the fused stride for the result matrix transpose.
179  const auto* MADNESS_RESTRICT const result_extent =
180  result.range().extent_data();
181  typename Result::size_type result_outer_stride = 1ul;
182  for (unsigned int i = perm[ndim1] + 1u; i < ndim; ++i)
183  result_outer_stride *= result_extent[i];
184 
185  // Copy data from the input to the output matrix via a series of matrix
186  // transposes.
187  for (typename Result::size_type i = 0ul; i < other_fused_size[0]; ++i) {
188  typename Result::size_type index = i * other_fused_weight[0];
189  for (typename Result::size_type j = 0ul; j < other_fused_size[2];
190  ++j, index += other_fused_weight[2]) {
191  // Compute the ordinal index of the input and output matrices.
192  typename Result::size_type perm_index = perm_index_op(index);
193 
194  math::transpose(input_op, output_op, other_fused_size[1],
195  other_fused_size[3], result_outer_stride,
196  result.data() + perm_index, other_fused_weight[1],
197  arg0.data() + index, (args.data() + index)...);
198  }
199  }
200  }
201 }
202 
203 } // namespace detail
204 } // namespace TiledArray

Compute the fused dimensions for permutation.

void vector_ptr_op(Op &&op, const std::size_t n, Result *const result, const Args *const ... args)
